thread.title: Arsenal FC news: Arsene Wenger will cut all ties if he quits this summer | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal FC news: Arsene Wenger will cut all ties if he quits this summer | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal FC news: Arsene Wenger will cut all ties if he quits this summer | Metro News
text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 7:29 pm Arsene Wengerâ€™s time at Arsenal appears to be coming to an end (Getty) 
Arsene Wenger will cut all ties with Arsenal should he leave the Emirates at the end of the season, according to reports. 
The Frenchman looks increasingly likely to call time on his era in North London following the 5-1 thrashing at the hands of Bayern Munich. Prior to the Champions League humiliation there was already much speculation that after 20-years at the club Wenger would depart, with his contract due to expire in the summer. Paul Pogba shows brotherly love after Florentin is forced off injured 
According to the Mirror should Wenger go he will not move upstairs at the Emirates, with the prospect of him doing so already ruled out. Instead he will walk away entirely from the club. 
It mean there will not be a similar scenario to the one seen at Manchester United when Sir Alex Ferguson brought his own long spell as manager to an end. The Scot was immediately named as a director and ambassador for the Red Devils. Ferguson continues to play a role at Old Trafford (Getty) Arsene Wenger in numbers
